kind.name: bug
kind.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

kind.name: feature
kind.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

kind.name: documentation
kind.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to documentation.

priority.name: awaiting-more-evidence
priority.description: Lowest priority. Possibly useful, but not yet enough support to actually get it done.

priority.name: critical-urgent
priority.description: Highest priority. Must be actively worked on as someone's top priority right now.

priority.name: important-longterm
priority.description: Important over the long term, but may not be staffed and/or may need multiple releases to complete.

priority.name: important-soon
priority.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.

lifecycle.name: active
lifecycle.description: Indicates that an issue or PR is actively being worked on by a contributor.

lifecycle.name: frozen
lifecycle.description: Indicates that an issue or PR should not be auto-closed due to staleness.

lifecycle.name: rotten
lifecycle.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

lifecycle.name: stale
lifecycle.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

type.name: lgtm
type.description: Indicates that a PR is ready to be merged.

type.name: approved
type.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver.

type.name: ok-to-test
type.description: Indicates a non-member PR verified by an org member that is safe to test.
